max_deductions = rule.variable(payslip.date_payment)['max_deductions']
qpp_ytd = payslip.ytd_amount('QPP_EE_C') + QPP_EE_C ppip_ytd = payslip.ytd_amount('PPIP_EE_C') + PPIP_EE_C ei_ytd = payslip.ytd_amount('EI_EE_C') + EI_EE_C
deductions = [ {'C': QPP_EE_C, 'YTD': qpp_ytd, 'max': max_deductions['QPP']}, {'C': PPIP_EE_C, 'YTD': ppip_ytd, 'max': max_deductions['PPIP']}, {'C': EI_EE_C, 'YTD': ei_ytd, 'max': max_deductions['EI']} ]
# get the higher from 2 methods allowed by the CRA
result_1 = 0 for d in deductions: result_1 += min(d['YTD'] + PR * d['C'], d['max'])
result_2 = 0 for d in deductions: result_2 += min(P * d['C'], d['max'])
result = max(result_1, result_2)
result = max(result, 0)
